Hi everyone,

just tried to build me a little rover in the VAB but had some problems with the structural part "The Not-Rockomax Micronode".

When I tried to put any other part on his sides it always placed the part INSIDE of the micronode.

Don't know if this bug is already known but it's a bit annoying.

You have to rotate it around (randomly!) until it turns green to attach it to something, and then the next part has to attach to the opposite side (sort of like a stack part). After that it works normally. You can then remove the 2nd part if you just wanted an L shape or something.

I'm guessing (some of) the surfaces are inside out, but it gets so little use no one's ever gotten around to fixing it.

I just checked and the side nodes on the not-rockomax micronode are indeed inverted in the config. Workarounds are to either use the rotate gizmo after placing in order to turn the part the right way, or edit the config to swap the signs of the 1s in the right, left, back, and front nodes.
